message:
hey everyone .....
i'm looking for API  that converting names form English to Arabic like 
Mohammed => محمد
Ahmed => احمد 
which only used for converting name

data.message: I am not sure if such thing exists but I can help you with a Google search keyword.. .This process is called "Transliteration". So I would start by looking for "Arabic transliteration" ...
I know that this is not answer for your question. But I tried the Google translation now for many names and some of them are not popular and it translates it well.

The term is transliteration. There were three main players in this space:
1) Microsoft has a product called Maren that does that (disclaimer: I was involved in that).  There used to be plans for an api but I am not sure if that ever shipped.
http://afkar.microsoft.com/en/maren/

2) Yamli also has a similar product and I think at one point in time they did have an API 
http://www.yamli.com

3) Google had a service called Google transliterate and now they have merged it with something called Google Input Tools.
http://www.google.com/inputtools/services/features/transliteration.html

You can look up 'Buckwalter' transformation. It's a standard set by IBM that is widely used in research into Arabic. Thing is, it represents letters that aren't in English with a combination of letters and numbers. You can find a lot of implementations of it, so you can also edit that to remove the unhelpful characters and you're good to go.

مظنش ان الموضوع الترجمه الحرفيه حينفع 
اولا، فيه اختلافات كتير في الإسم الواحد بالانجليزي بس المقابل في العربي واحد بس صح
وهل عايز تقبل فرانكو ولا لأ
اظن لو ملقيتش API ذكية بشكل كافي مع الأسماء بالذات حتحتاج تكتب Class محترمة تعدل الأسامي الأول وتجهزها للتحويل
مثلا، اي Abd,Abdul,Abdel, Abd el...
تحولها الأول ل 3bd مثلا وبالتالي لما تترجم تطلع صح
طبعا ده محتاج شغل جامد و testing على اسامي كتير جدا وتشوف ايه محتاج يتعدل
ياريت لو نويت تعمل كدة تخليها Open Source وتبعتهالنا نساعدك فيها :)

انا كان عندي عميل عايز حاجة زي دي وكان عنده ملفات اكسل فيها حوالي مليون صف اسامي رباعية كانت عايزة تترجم  يعني حوالي اربعة مليون اسم وكانت اسامية سورية ومصرية وفلبينية وبنجلادش والسودان  وسحبتهم كلهم وحذفت كل المتشابه والمكرر وصفو على حوالي 60 الف اسم اديتهم لكذا حد داتا انتري ترجمهوملي وترجمتله بيهم الملفات الاكسل بعد كده

We used Yamli with a limited success around 30% couple of years ago. We had some ideas to improve the out come by checking if the word is translatable against Google Translate first but we abandoned the project.

As Mohab Elkaref said, Buckwalter' transformation is a well known transliteration tool for that.You can read Nizar Habash paper about the tool here, https://scholar.google.co.uk/scholar?q=arabic+transliteration+&btnG=&hl=en&as_sdt=0%2C5

I'd like to add a small point about Maren and Yamli that you might find useful, from my use I noticed that Maren is optimized for the Egyptian accent while Yamli can recognize your accent from the corrections you make and change its suggestions to follow that accent :)

كومنت بعيد شوية عن الموضوع الاصلي
انا كنت عملت keyboard layout عشان اسهل كتابه العربي بس من غير اي برامج او مواقع بينزل زي اي لغه عاديه
جربوه بقى :D
www.3arabik.com
